title: Thomas Peterffy
deleted: During the 2021 [[GameStop short squeeze]] Peterffy openly admitted to criminal market manipulation in an interview with CNBC. Interactive Brokers shutdown the ability to buy several stocks which his, already deeply in losses, [[Hedge fund]] [[Securities fraud|friends]] heavilly shorted. He claimed that the broker would resume trading of these stocks when the price drops to "normal prices"; prices he deemed low enough that would not put his friends at risk of liquidation.<ref>https://www.cnbc.com/video/2021/01/28/pro-watch-cnbcs-full-interview-with-interactive-brokers-thomas-peterffy.html</ref>

title: Thomas Peterffy
added: In January 2021, Peterffy appeared live on CNBC during the GME market surge, and openly admitted to manipulating the market to protect the investments of himself and short sale investors because he did not deem the value of GME to be correct. He therefore restricted trading of stock on the open market to save funds $10-15 billion dollars because they chose to ignore risk assessment and take short positions that they couldn't back.<ref>{{https://www.cnbc.com/2021/01/28/interactive-brokers-restricted-gamestop-trading-to-protect-the-market-says-chairman-peterffy.html}}</ref>
